definition: (interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished

sentences.english: You wonder at the miracle of this awesome display of Nature.
sentences.chinese: 你对自然的这个令人敬畏的展示奇迹啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: There was tut - tutting about American profligacy .
sentences.chinese: 中国对美国的肆意挥霍发出了不满的啧啧声。

sentences.english: It's hard to say "gee whiz" anymore.
At age 12, he stood here in Zhaolin Park and marveled at an ice replica of the Yellow Crane Tower, an ancient pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 12岁时，他曾对兆麟公园的冰雕黄鹤楼啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: The dunes are among the highest in the world and they are spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 这是世界上最高的沙漠，令人啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: The teacher tut-tutted about his students' bad performance in the exam.
sentences.chinese: 老师对学生在考试中的糟糕表现啧啧不已。

sentences.english: The teacher  tut-tutted about his students’ bad performance in the exam.
sentences.chinese: 老师对学生在考试中的糟糕表现啧啧不已。
我心里暗暗地啧啧称赞。

definition: (interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
